feed.title: Google Cloud: Cloud Monitoring
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Cloud Monitoring

entry.content: You can now monitor and understand the costs and utilization of resources in your Google Cloud project or App Hub application by using the Cost Explorer. This feature is in Public Preview. For more information, see Optimize costs with the Cost Explorer.
entry.summary: Monitor and understand costs and utilization in your Google Cloud project or App Hub application using Cost Explorer. This feature is in Public Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Cost Explorer Now Available in Public Preview

entry.content:
Application-specific resource attributes are attached to your trace data when your App Hub applications use supported Google Cloud resources, or when you instrument an application with OpenTelemetry and use the Google Cloud Telemetry endpoint. To learn more, see the following:

  • Application Monitoring overview
  • View application telemetry
  • Find and explore traces
  • Telemetry (OTLP) API overview
entry.summary: Get application-specific resource attributes with App Hub and OpenTelemetry.
entry.title: Feature: New feature for application monitoring

entry.content:
You can now add treemap widgets to your custom dashboards. Treemaps display the most recent value of aggregated data as a series of nested rectangles, the color saturation of a rectangle is proportional to the represented value. For more information, see the following:

  • Display the most recent value as a treemap
  • API: Dashboard with a Treemap widget
entry.summary: You can now add treemap widgets to your custom dashboards. Treemaps display the most recent value of aggregated data as a series of nested rectangles, where color saturation is proportional to the represented value.
entry.title: Feature: New treemap widgets for custom dashboards
